definition.title: What is SEO Optimization?
definition.content: SEO optimization is the process of making your content more visible to search engines. This includes writing compelling title tags, meta descriptions, and strategically placing keywords—all designed to help your content rank higher and get more clicks.

landingContent.formula: [PRIMARY KEYWORD] + [COMPELLING TITLE] + [BENEFIT-DRIVEN META] + [NATURAL INTEGRATION] = SEO-Optimized Content
tips: Front-load keywords in titles - put the most important terms in the first 50 characters
Write for clicks, not just ranking - a higher CTR can improve rankings over time
Include a CTA in meta descriptions - tell searchers what they'll get or learn
Match search intent - understand if searchers want to learn, buy, or find something specific

faq.question: How long should title tags be?
faq.answer: 50-60 characters to avoid truncation in search results. Front-load your main keyword.

faq.question: What makes a good meta description?
faq.answer: 150-160 characters, includes main keyword, has a clear value proposition, and ends with a call to action.

faq.question: How many keywords should I target?
faq.answer: One primary keyword and 2-3 secondary keywords per page. Focus on relevance over quantity.

faq.question: Does this replace an SEO tool?
faq.answer: It complements SEO tools by helping with on-page optimization. Use alongside tools like Ahrefs or Semrush for full SEO strategy.
